sub_title: Principal Petroleum Engineer at Tullow Oil

profile_positions.description:
I identify and lead technical and commercial multi-disciplinary project work for Tullow’s portfolio of fields and opportunities in the Dutch sector. Recent examples include: design and execution of an outstep exploration well test programme, and subsequent analysis; gas field conceptual development study; third party access negotiation; portfolio reserves evaluation audit; abandonment study

Focal point for the Dutch non-operated technical activities, and I act as the Tullow technical representative in these Joint Ventures. 

Advise and steer exploration/development planning in Tullow operated blocks, including coordination of data gathering and studies

Provision of technical, economic and commercial inputs and support to the ongoing Tullow E&P Netherlands divestment

Interim Acting Commercial Manager

Quality Assurance advisor in Tullow international exploration/development assessments

In a parallel employment contract, I coordinate gas sales and administer related processing / transportation agreements at Total EP Netherlands BV
profile_positions.title: Principal Petroleum Engineer

profile_positions.description:
3 roles: Reservoir Engineering Discipline Coordinator, Senior RE, and Project Manager. In addition, facilitator role in TNO Oil & Gas strategy formation, and QMS manager
Projects included technology innovation projects, computer-aided production optimisation studies in the Middle East, construction of a national geological drilling hazards database, and evaluation of Dutch geothermal projects’ performance
profile_positions.title: Senior Reservoir Engineer & Discipline Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Short term contract to provide capability assessment, coaching structures and training events to the KOC Gas Development Group, as part of a Shell ETSA contract on deep sour gas fields
profile_positions.title: Training Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Shell has set up a team to steer the company towards a CO2-constrained world. Within that team, my role was:
-	to ensure that CO2 and energy efficiency concepts and targets are incorporated in key corporate guidelines and standards
-	to work with Shell Businesses to ensure that they are effectively managing their project porffolio, from a CO2 abatement and energy efficiency perspective
-	to work with major CO2-emitter projects to ensure that they fully understand their CO2 exposure, correctly explore their technical and commercial abatement options, and manage their stakeholders
-	to mature and enable CCS and CO2 EOR projects
-	to assist these major projects in getting Functional Support signoff
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor CO2 Projects

profile_positions.description:
The sole full-time enabler/facilitator/”value assurance advisor” in this large 5000-staff company, supporting +/- 60 teams per year in optimizing their strategy. Whilst originally focused on Petroleum Engineering, the scope has widened substantially to include: Development Concepts, Engineering, Operations, Well & Reservoir Management, HR, IT, External Affairs, Environmental, Corporate Social Investment, Technology, and specialist technical communities… Based on detailed customer satisfaction responses, my clients scored my performance very highly – on average at 4.6 on a scale of 0-5. Specifically, my ability to provide a clear second-opinion challenge, as well as providing a robust structure designed to get maximum project value. Let me be clear: this is not just about running a workshop; this is primarily about adding value by understanding the technical/organizational issues, threats and opportunities, and delivering the client to a successful outcome.

-	Opportunity Framing

-	Concept Identification

-	Concept Selection 

-	Strategy Definition

-	Process/Workflow Mapping

-	Technical Audit Review

-	Contractor/Tender Support

-	Environmental / Sustainable Development Project Manager
profile_positions.title: Reaching the Limit Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The Senior Reservoir Engineer for the offshore ON-AC asset, containing some 33 producing or close to development gas fields.

-	Capacity optimisation & enhancement
Coordinator of well-related activity programme, including production allocation, non-routine well services, and capacity enhancements. In the well activity team, I devoted much effort to team-building, including coaching and regular meetings to discuss team activities and roles. Team leader for subsurface capacity enhancement evaluation and proposal preparation. 

-	Study Team Leader
Team leader for development optimization strategy study for K15-FL gas field. Responsible for team of 8 technical and commercial colleagues, leading to recommendation for optimum development concept, taking into account unitisation and third party development options

-	Gas sales forecasting
Responsible for D15 and Lo-Cal capacity forecasts using Genrem reservoir simulator. 

-	Reserves management & audit
Coordinator of reserves portfolio and business plan input. 

-	Late life & liquid loading issues
Particular focus on liquid loading problems. Subsurface support to various brownfield project studies. Highlight was production forecasting, economic evaluation and commercial strategy input for end of life strategy of K11-B & K12-B fields.

-	Other
Active non-operator role in various third party fields, including dedicated studies, commercial evaluations, and representation of company at partner meetings. Applicant focal point for sustainable development. On leadership team of Nam Project Better World.
profile_positions.title: Senior Reservoir Engineer & Asset Discipline Lead

profile_positions.description:
EBN represents the interests of the Dutch state in almost all gas fields in the Netherlands. It has a non-operating interest of 40-50% in these fields, and in the associated infra-structure.  As Senior Reservoir Engineer, I was responsible for all underground aspects of the offshore fields of the two biggest operators, some 60 fields in total.

-	Strategic studies & Development optimization
The work consists inter alia of the evaluation and monitoring of the appraisal, development and production phases of these fields, with emphasis on optimisation of project value and gas production. Also much involved in contractual and infrastructure aspects. Computer simulation and spreadsheet models used to optimise field and infrastructure development.

-	Production Licence Application audits
-	Support to Ministry and gas purchaser
Involved in advisory role to Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs inter alia regarding the evaluation of development projects in new licence areas, and general optimisation of oil industry climate.
profile_positions.title: Senior Reservoir Engineer & Asset Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Solely responsible for all technical aspects of inter alia six producing oil fields, 35 gas fields in which the company had a (non-operating) interest in the Netherlands, Spain, Tunisia and the UK. This work included evaluation and monitoring of the development of these fields and concomitant operations, evaluation (calculation) of production performance and reserves, analysis of expenditures, and representation of the company in formal meetings.  

-	Focal point for some 60 acquisition exercises
An important area of activity was the detailed technical evaluation and financial valuation of some 50-60 oil and gas fields, as part of a 100+ million Euro energy investment fund. These fields were located in inter alia the UK, the Netherlands, Norway, France, Spain, North Africa, Central Africa, Indonesia, Turkey.  A key success was an original subsurface evaluation of the Casablanca Field in Spain, leading to two highly successful acquisitions,

-	Development optimization
-	Company representative at TCM’s OCM’s
-	Negotiator of transport, POSA, unitisation & abandonment agreements
-	
-	Other
Other  activities included preparation of petroleum engineering  reports, and  support to  exploration and  appraisal activities in various other countries and areas. During this period also editor of Society of Petroleum Engineers Dutch Section magazine.
profile_positions.title: Production Manager

profile_positions.description:
Staff Petroleum Engineer 
Goal Petroleum, London  - 1984-1986 
Responsible for all engineering and reservoir engineering aspects of one producing and two developing oil fields in which the company had an interest. Work consisted of monitoring of development and operational activites, and evaluation of production performance, detailed reserves calculations, control of budgets, and representing the
company at meetings. 

Petroleum Engineer
Gaffney Cline  & Associates, Oil Industry Consultancy, England - 1981-1984 
Petroleum/reservoir engineer involved in various client studies. In particular, manager of several long-term retainer projects, involved in  evaluation and  monitoring of field  development and operational activities on behalf of individual licencees. Also as manager, responsible for feasibility study for UK North Sea field development, leading to formal Annex-B preparation and submission to Department of Energy. 


Wellsite Petroleum Engineer
Nederlandse Aardolie Maatschappij, Assen – 1979-1981
The Wellsite Petroleum Engineer acted (together with the Toolpusher) as on-site manager and company representative on a contract land drilling rig in the Netherlands. Responsibilities included management of drilling fluids, geological evaluation, supervision of logging and casing activities.

Reservoir Engineer
Shell Internationale Petroleum Mij., The Hague - 1977-1978
Reservoir engineer responsible for the evaluation and prediction of production behaviour of a number of fields, particularly in the Paris Basin.
profile_positions.title: Prior Roles

company.name: Environment Society of Oman - جمعية البيئة العمانية

volunteer_experiences.description: Responsible for  setting up recycling projects and giving environmental awareness talks/workshops to schools, companies and communities over a 4 year period 2004-2009 in Oman
Set up volunteer groups in Shell and TNO head offices in the Netherlands  between 2009 and 2012, and organised/participated in many social support activities
During 2009-2012, gave energy-environment-society awareness talks at schools, as part of an initiative to encourage students to choose a technical career
